intro: Ligusticum ibukiense, commonly known as the Ibuki mountain lovage, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, hollow stems and compound leaves with a strong, spicy scent. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Ligusticum ibukiense is often found in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions.
